subject: Real Estate
title: Euclidean Zoning: Separating Everything
description: Learn Euclidean Zoning: Separating Everything in one minute.

hook.text: In 1926, the Supreme Court upheld Euclid, Ohio's right to separate homes from factories. Zoning was born.

buildup.text: Euclidean zoning divides cities into single-use zones: residential here, commercial there, industrial over there.

discovery.text: The idea worked for keeping smokestacks away from bedrooms â€” but it created car-dependent sprawl.

twist.text: By separating shops, offices, and homes, zoning made it impossible to walk anywhere useful.

climax.text: Modern planners now push mixed-use zoning â€” the exact opposite of what the 1926 ruling encouraged.

punchline.text: We separated everything. Now we're trying to put it back.
